summary: Richard N Billings is listed as an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978 and 1979. These documents detail the committee's staff, their positions, and salaries during the investigation into the JFK assassination. Billings appears consistently across these reports, indicating his ongoing employment with the committee during the specified periods. The documents do not provide specific details about Billings' role or responsibilities within the committee, only his presence on the payroll.
significance: Richard N Billings' significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, as evidenced by his inclusion in multiple payroll and certification reports. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed, his presence indicates his involvement in the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination.
